Description: Book of Breathing of Tahefat (thirteen fragments); row of full colour vignettes at top; Hieratic text.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Thebes. Found with P. BM EA 10256 probably inside the coffin BM EA 6708 in the collective tomb of the archon Soter (see Herbin 2008, 141).
Curator's comments: To be published by F. Herbin, Late Religious Texts. 3
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (237)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57798) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57798)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, bloom, discoloured Black ink Pigment Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass (warped) Sandwich: board Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fair/fragmentary
